desc1: Students are led step-by-step through the process of building a basic LEGO® MINDSTORMS® robot  to introduce fundamental principles and concepts. Instructors will guide groups of students through live-sessions in order to ensure full participation and mastery of the concepts. Students in grades K-3 are encouraged to apply for the common build.
desc1_2: All parts required for the build are included in the course, free of charge. Once you're accepted, we will email you for instructions on how to get started!
desc2: All classes will be taught remotely via RoboReach’s native livestream feature. If accepted, you’ll receive an email and be prompted to make an account.

weeks.title: Week 0
weeks.desc: We’ll ship you all the materials you need for the first week’s lesson. This week will focus on knowing what you have and how to use each part!

weeks.title: Weeks 1-4
weeks.desc: Build your robot! We’ll walk through the instructions with you on not only how to build your robot but also in best practices!

weeks.title: Week 5-8
weeks.desc: Program your robot! We’ll walk through how to write code to move the robot the way you’d like.

desc4: Students in the common build program do not need any previous programming or mechanical experience. They will learn everything from scratch!

desc1: Students are given tasks that the robot should be able to complete, designing and building the robot from a variety of available parts. Instructors will guide students through each step of the process through live chat and video. Students in grades 4-7 are encouraged to apply for the challenge build.
desc1_2: All parts required for the build are included in the course, free of charge. Once you're accepted, we will email you for instructions on how to get started!
desc2: All classes will be taught remotely via RoboReach’s native livestream feature. If accepted, you’ll receive an email and be prompted to make an account.

weeks.title: Week 0
weeks.desc: We’ll ship you all the materials you need for the first week’s lesson. This week will focus on knowing what you have and how to use each part!

weeks.title: Week 1-3
weeks.desc: Build the drivetrain! We’ll walk through the instructions with you on not only how to build your robot but also in best practices!

weeks.title: Week 3-5
weeks.desc: Add the functionality of the robot! Whether it be arms, claws, or any other part, we’ll walk through how to build it!

weeks.title: Week 5-8
weeks.desc: Program your robot! We’ll walk through how to write code to move the robot the way you’d like.

desc4: Students in the challenge build program should have basic programming and mechanical experience. There will be a lot of challenges to solve!

desc1: Each student will design and create a unique build that addresses a problem they decide on. Students will be matched with a mentor who will guide them through the entire process, helping them decide on materials, a design, and the building process
desc1_2: All parts required for the build are included in the course, free of charge. Once you're accepted, we will email you for instructions on how to get started!
desc2: All classes will be taught remotely via RoboReach’s native livestream feature. If accepted, you’ll receive an email and be prompted to make an account.

weeks.title: Week 0
weeks.desc: We will ship out a base kit full of things students will use to help them throughout the course remotely!

weeks.title: Week 1
weeks.desc: Students will learn/review basic mechanical design prociples and practices and learn how to fully utlize the provided base engineering kit!

weeks.title: Week 2
weeks.desc: Full familirzed with mechanical design, students will start to braistorm and design their robots. this means outlining a specific purpose, design overview and a construction timeline. our mentors will help students design a robot that they are not only passionate about, but is feasible to fully construct through remote instruction!

weeks.title: Week 3
weeks.desc: This is when all students will finalize their design using Computer Aided Design to hash out specifics such as materials, assembly, and electronics. Students will also have the option to custom design metal parts for our mentors to fabricate in their professional facilities using tools such as a metal cnc, lathe, and drill press!

weeks.title: Week 4-6
weeks.desc: After the needed materials and tools are gathered and shipped to the students, they will fully construct their robot in accordance to how they designed it in week 3.

weeks.title: Week 7-8
weeks.desc: In the final weeks of the program, students finish up any finsihing touches to their robot and create presentations and pitches for their robots for not only parents, but industry professionals for review and critique!

desc4: Students in the creative build program should have either compeleted the challenge build or have a decent amount of previous experience in robotics. There is much less 'hand-holding' than in the challenge build!
